jazz in the last 5 years has progressed in its fits and starts of sudden discoveries and startled reactions. new principles new sounds new rhythms and harmonies have been advanced with unusual frequency not surprisingly many of the younger musicians have been quietly digesting this information almost as quiuckly as it has appeared as a result theyve acquired a degree of musical sophistication which supersedes many of the previous standards of excellence so its no longer especially relevant to ask the young saxophone player for example to demonstrate his ability by running through all the charlie parker licks
